reviews:
How: Can.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Amber colour with an off-white head.
Aroma: Malt, caramel, hops, citrus, grapefruit, grass.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Malt, caramel, fruit, hops, citrus.

Pours redish almost clear amber with a medium lasting off white head. Nose is roasted bread a little pine resin, chocolate. Taste: Malt, liqourice, roasted, good mouth bitterness. Overall: Nice and heavy ale I like it.

Stovepipe can. Brown pour with reddish highlights when held to a light. Big sudsy beige head with good retention and ample lacing. 
The aroma is strong with pine resins and toffee. The taste is bitter hops forward with bitter pine, sticks, leaves and dark malts. Palate is full and viscous. Finishes long and bitter. Overall: decent. Revisiting an old favorite, I haven't had one of these these since about 2008(or so). Seems to me they have upped the IBU's. This strikes me as a beer that is bitter just for bitters sake

Rödbrun färg och fint beiget skum med små bubblor, ger ett maltigt intryck rent visuellt. Kraftig arom med fruktiga och knäckiga toner, men också en frisk parfymerad citrusdoft som väger upp det hela snyggt. 

Medium kropp med relativt torrt avslut vilket behövs för att öka drickbarheten! En del maltsmak av karamell och frukt, men väldigt mycket humle; kåda, tall och citrus. Beskan dominerar och sitter kvar länge. Inte en balanserad öl, vill uppenbarligen sticka ut! Intressant att den är så gigantisk i smaken utan att kännas kladdig eller rörig, välbryggd på så sätt. Beskan är för kraftig för min smak, den är skarp och gräsig, en rejäl käftsmäll. Inget man glömmer i första taget, men helt klart intressant och tänjer på gränserna. Gillar aromen väldigt mycket, mer än smaken. Jag förstår tjusningen och gillar man kraftfulla smakupplevelser som ger en kick, typ som att äta en riktigt stark vindaloo, så är detta en mycket bra öl för ändamålet då den också är välbryggd. Problemet med denna typ av öl som ska tänja på gränserna tycker jag ofta är att de blir endimensionella, men här finns absolut flera lager, även om det inte riktigt är för mig.

Dimmigt mahogny med tjockt beige skum. Doftar fruktigt, maltigt, lite kryddigt och pepprig, kaffe och choklad.. Smaken fyllig, lite söt, sedan besk. Eftersmaken lång, gräddig med markant beska. Mer IPA än Ale.
Can. Dark brown with a beige head. Heavy aroma of makt, yeast and alcohol. Really bitter - not for everyone.

Dark brown colour with a creamy head.
Aroma: roasted malt, chocolate, cacao, raisins, some caramel. 
Taste: roasted malt, hops, cacao, coffee. Dry, coffee-ish bitterness.

2 finger warm beige head. Dissipates rather quickly. Small bits of lacing.
Semi-clear, deep ruby coloured beer.

Aroma of copper, oats, raisins, white grape and a hint of lemon. Very subdued.

Taste of the same minus white grape and lemon. Add instead pillowy soft grains with a touch of bitter coffee and rye in the finish.

Mouthfeel is silky soft with a great medium-high creeping bitterness. Low carbonation. Slightly sticky. Not too heavy.

Overall: A great staple beer. Mild like a, well... Mild. But with a bigger landing and much more bitter. Infinitely satisfying in its simplicity.
Burk från systembolaget. Bärnstensfärgad öl med beiget skum. Trevlig öl med fina toner av karamell, humle, grapefrukt och granskott. Torr fin avslutning.

Can @ Friends/Chef: Pours clear amber/copper with good off-white soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: barley, bread, caramel, pine, alcohol, light citrus, light toast, light berries, light metallic, molasses and grassy notes. palette: strong hoppy aroma, average carbonation, medium to full body, average to high sweetness, dominated by a notable bitterness, average to long duration, bitter and light dry finish and an oily texture. Overall: bombastic US strong ale

De color ámbar obscuro - marrón, es turbia con restos abundantes de levadura de gran tamaño que dan un aspecto peculiar al líquido. Forma una espuma de baja altura de color blanco, que no persiste mucho y tiene mediana retención.
En nariz es floral, algo frutal, pero no sé destaca la malta, si acaso en una ligera nota a caramelo escondida en el fondo.
En boca es amarga de entrada. Refrescante, destaca el lupulo, con un trasfondo algo dulce que equilibra.
Kastanjefarvet, uklar med fint brunt skum. Let citrus og karamel duft. Stærk lakridssmag med fin bitterhed.
Bruin bier met stevige schuimkraag. Na openen spuit het bier eruit. Smaak is bitter en licht kruidig met iets van hars, wat dennen en gras. Heel aparte, maar eenmaal gewend een goede smaak.
Mørk kraftig maltet humlet frugtig ale, med bitter malt eftersmag der varer ved.
One pint 3.2fl oz can brought back for me from Dallas. Pours dark red with a white head. Aroma of malt and fruity hops. Bitter taste and finish.

Tap at Besk - wow - such a fine looking ale in the glass with impeccable lacing - super-powered malty aroma a bit like a wee heavy Scottish ale or a dense red ale but better - superbly malty ale with elements of Christmas cake. Soooo drinkable. Gotta say I’m not a malt fan usually but this blew my tiny brain. Lovely.
Can.Dark reddish colour with small head.Aroma of roasted malt and dark dried fruits nice with good full body and malt finish.
Deliciously hoppy red ale. Nuff said for this classic. Takes me back to 2012 in Austin, TX :)

Can from HavnensVin&Tobak. Pours clear dark chestnut brown with medium offwhite head. Aroma is malt, caramel, brown sugar, fudge, rye bread and hints of cinnamon, cardamom and sweet liquorice. Taste is medium sweet, light to medium bitter, light acidic and faint salty. Body is oily with light carbonation. Finish is long and balanced sweet and bitter with notes of brown sugar, caramel, butterscotch, roasted barley, chocolate malt, dried fruit (dates, raisins), bitter grapefruit zest, grassy hops and hints of oak, mint and liquorice. Quite complex and arrogant ;-)

Piana średnia, beżowa, trwała, zostawiała lacing na szkle, z pewną ilością średnich pęcherzy. Kolor prześwitujący ciemny brąz. Aromat owocowy i słodowy, karmel, przyprawy, cynamon. Smak początek lekko wytrawny, wręcz ze sporą ilością goryczki, ale przebijają się karmel, słód, trochę czekolada i kawa, z czasem te składowe bardziej intensywne, do tego coś owocowego jak grejpfrut, daktyle. Pierwsze piwo w tym stylu i super doświadczenie.

Aroma of brown sugar, malt, burned caramel, cinnamon and spices
Brownred colour with medium lasting head
Taste is malt, licorice, bitter citrus fruits, dates, brown sugar and molasses
Smooth oily mouthfeel with low carbonation
Great beer
Tasted at home

Almisser deep red colour with large brown / red foam. Smell of malt, caramel and dried fruit. Taste is strong with malt, lightly salted dried fruits, nuts, dades, licorice and a fantastic bitterness. Lasting aftertaste.
Really appreciate this ale.

Lattina. Il gusto al naso è indirizzato verso l'orzo tostato. L'olfatto viene stimolato in maniera normale e l'esistenza olfattiva è sufficiente. Il cappello di schiuma ha una buona tenuta. La grandezza delle bollicine è medio-fine. Il liquido è di aspetto velato. Il colore è ambrato rossiccio carico tendente marrone. Il corpo è pieno. L'amaro è deciso. La forza gustativa è elevata e la permanenza è buona. Le sensazioni boccali finali risultano di birra beverina. Il retrogusto è intenso. Al gusto vengono donati toni di caramello, miele, frutta secca, luppolo, resina e agrumi.

color: marron oscuro casi negro, espuma cremosa y tostada de un par de dedos.
olor: malta tostada y caramelo, pino, 
sabor: amargor medio-alto, cuerpo medio, oleosa, al final persiste el amargor.
Hazy brown with a massive off-white head. Rich hoppy aroma. Taste is spicy licorice, bitter malts with a gently bitter palate.

Aroma: Malty sweet with caramel and citrus. 
Flavour: Sweet malt and fruity with caramel and notes of citrus. Aftertaste is malty sweet. 
Colour: Amber with an offwhite head. 23/4-2018

Ar: ciemne i karmelowe slody, karmel, skorka ciemnego chleba, super intensywnosc. Wyg: ciemny, metnawy bursztyn, piana gruba, gruboziarnista, mega brudzi, jakas zawiesina wisi. Sm: wysycenie srednie, slodowo, lekka palonosc, duzo karmelu, zlozone, alko fajnie schowane, lekko w posmaku wychodzi, skorka chleba, lekka goryczka palono-karmelowa. Pos: Palono-karmelowa goryczka, lekkie alko w tle, dlugi i zmienny.
Blik 47,3cl thuis. Rood fruit, goed bitter, pine, grapefruit, maltig, caramel, licht stroperig, hoestdrank, kruidig, droog, flink hoppig. Geen doordrinker. (11-12-2020).

Aroma of some pine and sweet malt.  Reddish amber color with a thick tan head.  Rich sweet malt up front.  Fresh Caramel nots get hit with heavy piney bitterness.  Balance gives way to a resinous bitter coating on the finish.  Light to medium mouth feel with increasing bitterness in tongue during aftertaste.  A little boozy.  Good for bitter fans.

How: can. BB: 12/01/21
Head: off white, two fingers.
Colour: deep amber, hazy.
Aroma: red berries, caramel, bread, herbal, pine.
Taste: medium to full body, below average carbonation, red berries, caramel, bread, citrus fruits, herbal& resinous bitterness. Quite bitter.
Bread, caramel& red berries in long aftertaste.

Auf jeden Fall muss dieses Bier getestet werden, alleine schon wegen dem Text auf dem Etikett.
 Schaum relativ konstant.
Geruch: schokaladig karamellig maligne
Farbe: dunkel braun
Geschmack:Bitterschokolade die sich in Alkohol verliebt.
Schmeckt nicht jedem mir dafür umso mehr
Has a funky aftertaste, like that bitterness you get from trying to peel a grapefruit with your teeth. Not my favorite dark ale, probably wouldn’t get this again￼

16 oz. can. Deep ruby appearance with large caramel tinted foam head. Suds aggressively cling to the glass. Pine aroma. First sip is rather disagreeable and heavy. Had to stop and check the bitterness. 100 IBUs? In a 7%+ beer? Very strong and dry, driven by powerful barley and hops with almost no sweetness in sight. You'll get no mercy from this beer. The bitterness carries over into the aftertaste. Rye and charred barley. Smoky, burnt. Can't say I'm a huge fan of this. For a big beer from Stone, I would take Ruination over this any day.

All that's not to say this is a bad drink. Just harsh and relentless in bitterness. Probably better with dinner instead of solo. The biggest flaw here is the lack of balancing sweetness. As a Stone lover in general, this one is technically sound, just as a matter of preference not the style I would reach for.
Encore une bière surcotée qui a tout joué sur le design. Trés reussi au demeurant.Bien trop amère . Pour les amateurs de chocolat houblonné.

This is a strong beer. If you are not into or familiar with ipa’s I wouldn’t start with this one. For me I like it. Color is very dark, aroma is heavy, taste is good gets smoother as you keep drinking it the 1st few sips you’ll be like oohhh this is strong but after a few it’s good. Will definitely give you a buzz. Would definitely get this beer again.

Rood achtig bruin bier met weinig wit schuim. Smaakt alcohol zoet, en licht alcohol sterk. Heeft daarnaast lichte granen en bloemen. Ook is er een beetje perzik en citrus te proeven. Op het einde is er nog een karton achtig bittertje te proeven.
reddish brown with a small dense off white head. Medium sweet, low sour, high bitter. Prominent charred aroma, some caramel. Improves as it warms.

Can. Color: Murky reddish brown, yellowish white head. Aroma: Floral hop, malt, caramel. Taste: Floral and slightly citrus hopbitterness with caramel and malty background. Very slightly boozy. Over moderate bitterness, moderate sweet. Bitter and dry-ish hoppy finish. Ok.

This beer remind you one "IIPA - Imperial" but the taste is little more bitter and has less tropical fruits but in general remind you very well one "IIPA" beer.
The aroma is very strong and give you lot of hops and caramel nose. The taste is really very bitter in the beginning and more in the finish. The beer is very hoppy. Lot of caramel, grapefruit notes here. Also the beer is malty too and little dry. The carboration is moderate.
Overall i'm not big fan for bitter and very hoppy beers. So i can't be objective but if you like hoppy beers, this can satisfied you for sure.
Frisch fruchtige und vergoren fruchtige Noten. Den sehr hohen Alkoholgehalt merkt man kaum. Sehr herb bitter, bleibt noch lange im Mund. Ist mir etwas zu viel des guten.

Malty sweet and floral hop aroma.  Aroma reminds me of Dogfish Head IPAs.  Taste is, caramel malt at the start with a huge kick of grapefruit bitterness.  Bitter aftertaste that lingers.  I would classify this as an amber IPA.  Good for the style but it’s not my style

16 Fl Oz can. Pours brown with a reddish tinge and a large, beige head. Aromas of a bit of pine, some caramel, and woody notes. Tastes of nutty/woody malts, boozy, dry, bitter on the back end. Medium body, assertive carbonation, lingering boozy/bitter bite. A little intense for my tastes.

47.3cl can at home. Pours a dark amber/reddish colour with a medium-sized off-white head. Strong malty, piney aroma with some hops. Taste is 90% pine, malty, slightly hoppy and caramel.  A bitter finish and a heavy bitter aftertaste.

Notes found in an old notebook unearthed during a bit of spring cleaning. Drank sometime during 2010. Dark brown pour with a beige head. Stewed apple,coriander, cinnamon, blackberries in the aroma. Taste is bitter chocolate, sultanas,wood,raspberries. Good alcohol burn. Fierce hoppy finish.
Clear ruby red/orange pour. Malty nose. Boozy, caramel tones with a nice balanced bitterness
Bardzo wytrawne, mocno chmielone, nieco zalegające i łodygowe. Bardzo intensywnie.

Barwa ciemno bursztynowa, rubinowa. Piana biała, wysoka, trwała. Jest bardzo sztywna, ładnie krążkuje znacząc każdy łyk.
Aromat chmielowy, tutaj fajne, acz lekko intensywne nuty owocowe, ziołowe, dalej słodowe nuty karmelowe, ziemistość, akcenty tytoniowo popiołowe. 
W smaku najwyraźniejsze są popiołowe i tytoniowe akcenty, kolejna jest ziemistość, zioła, karmel i słodowość, nuty owocowe nieznaczne. Silna, intensywna goryczka to kolejny atrybut "Arroganta". 
Nasycenie średnie, pełnia powyżej średniej. Piwo jest nieco szorstkie. Posmak długi, karmelowo ziemisty.
Malty nose, nutty brown colour. Dirty white foam. Heavy alcohol taste, unrefined bitterness with malty flavours trying to balance it unsuccessfully. Average...

Poured into pint glass.  Dark amber color with frothy head.   First taste was big and bold and I didn’t think I was worthy.  But after a couple drinks this beer keeps you wanting more.   Great beer to enjoy while making dinner.  I will be buying more in the future

500 ml can. Pours dark ruby ​​brown in color with creamy foam. The aroma of roasted malt, nuts and dark fruits. The taste is pleasantly bitter and with nuts and grapefruit. A touch of alcohol in the aftertaste.

Color cobrizo, genera abundante espuma cremosa color canela. Huele de maravilla, a caramelo y cítricos. All echártela a la boca la Arrogant te sube a una montaña rusa de sensaciones. Quizás sea eso lo que desconcierta a tanta gente. Su lata de medio litro te hace transitar por el dulce caramelo de los malteados, tonos torrefactos, el amargor sin concesiones del lúpulo, pepinazos licorosos y un final seco. 

Está claro que para gustos los colores, pero a mí personalmente una birra que me remueve de ese modo… ME GUSTA!
Ar: malt, red fruit, berries, dark bread Ap: dark ruby, brown creamy head T: malty, med sweetness, dry finish P: med body
Aroma slightly hopped with American foreigners of maio. Dark ruby red color with dense and fairly persistent foam
Dark ruby red color with dense and fairly persistent foam. Aroma slightly hopped.

Pours reddish brown with a royal humongous foam crown. Aroma of cyrup, sweet malts, nuts and dark bread. Taste is initially sweet with flavors of cyrup and even a slight hint of red berries. Solid malty backbone, yeast and decent voltage of alcohol take over with a more bready and nutty taste. Hops bring in a nice dryish impression to finish. Medium bodied, overall a satisfying thick mouthfeel. Good balanced ale in all aspects, but unfortunately doesn't stand out either. Strong recommendation, but won't included in my tales of most epic beers.

Can from Alko Arkadia, Helsinki. Pours murky brown with a big frothy head. The aroma features a mix of bready, nutty maltiness and piney hoppiness. Taste is dry, initially malty, towards finish medium to heavily bitter. Dry nutty flavours dominate initially, later pine and a touch of grapefruit. Fairly balanced between malts and hops. The mouthfeel is medium-bodied and smooth, average carbonation. Decent brew.
Can. Dark amber color, steady thuck white head. Fruity, resinous aroma. Dry, high bitter taste. Hoppy floral, fruity aftertaste, caramel maltiness. Low carbonation, full body.

Bevuta alla spina.
Aroma lievemente luppolato con esteri americani di maio. Colore rosso rubino scuro con schiuma densa e abbastanza persistente.
Fgpr

Birra dal colore ambrato scuro un po' velata, con schiuma beige abbondandee persistente.  Al naso non è molto potente cmq si swntono aromi di malto, caramello, toffee, pane nero, agrumi, resina. In bocca le note sono più intense: caramello, toffee, pane nero agrumi, per poi virare decisamente verso un amaro deciso, resinoso, terroso. Un amaro che rimane ben presente anche nel retrogusto ben bilanciato dalle note màltate.

Pine, caramel, malts aroma.
Flavour is nuts and grapefruit. Intense bitterness, coffee. Alcohol is felt, but in an OK way. A bit metal in the aftertaste.
Interesting ale, even though alcohol breaks through.

Quite surprised that I missed rating this.  Pours a dark amber with a full beige head that settles slowly.  The aroma is big on pine and grapefruit, with milder caramel, raisin, and earthy malt.  The taste is dry and brings forth an intense bitterness.  Among the flavors, I still find potent pine along with a healthy resin.  There are moderate amounts of caramel and earth, and than gentle floral notes, raisin, and coffee.  Bitter pine finish.  Full bodied and smooth in texture.  You don't find very many like this one these days.  Solid and recommended.

0.5 l can. Pours clear amber with thick brownish head. A: white cabbage, malty T: medium body and carbonation, firstly harsh malty, harshness quickly disappeared with little bit of warmth, then it gets nice and smooth with some light coffee notes

Can 0,50L. Clear ruby/amber color with big, frothy, off-white head. Aroma of roasted malts, caramel, nuts, candy, biscuits and gentle hint of dark fruits.  Taste is heavy to harsh bitter and with nuts and grapefruit. A touch of alcohol in the aftertaste. Medium to full body, dry texture, soft carbonation,  metallic finish.

Cherry-colored, hazy, nice creamy head. Aroma is sweet, candy, sugar, cherries, grapes, sweet malt and nuts. Unlike the aroma, the taste is of an intense and deep bitter, a lots of hops, the alcohol is there but very soft, with hints of cherries. The finish is long and strongly bitter. The bitterness in the taste and in the aftertaste is very nice.

Can. Hazy, dark chestnut brown, coppery. Sizeable offwhite head, foamy and lasting. Mild biscuity nose, some nuts and sweet fruity notes, hints of roast. Moderate bitterness, hoppy and herbal. Lasting aftertaste. Some alcohol warmth.
It's all brute without any real finesse. It's like using a three-wood when you're already on the green.

MANY Years ago when I tried this I admittedly fell into the “you’re not worthy” category.  Palates change, and I’d say this strong ale is delicious.  Malty, with mild alcohol burn, and with a wonderful hop presence at the back end.  Great American sipper.
Fantastisch arrogant bastard ale met 7,2% alcohol van de Stone Brouwerij in Berlijn. Donker, hoppig, zoetig, zeer onderscheidende smaak.

Riecht würzig, dunkel röstig und leicht fruchtig. Ergießt sich dunkel und sehr trüb. Viel Schaum. Der Antrunk ist sehr vollmundig und kräftig. Schmeckt extrem intensiv, Aromen von Tannenharz, Aprikose, Beeren und Röstmalz. Bittert sehr stark bis in die Magengegend. Sehr langer Nachhall. Aussergewöhnliches IPA der extra Klasse

Pours a dingy brown and topped with a thicker head of off-white froth.  Aromas of earthy hops with a caramel malt backbone.  Taste shows bready, heavily toasted caramel malts.  Mouthfeel a sticky malt.  The hops are aggressive and the malt profile is in the background

rough hop aroma.
deep grapefruit body with a little sweety.
Long bitter aftertaste.

Can, medium long lasting off white, hazy seep red color,  bubbly head, caramel biscuit aroma with some herbs and a hint of smoke, caramel biscuity flavor with a strong and mellow grapefruit and shrubs bitterness that lingers and lingers, very nicely balanced. Very nice and enjoyable.

From can (brewed in Berlin). Pours clear dark brown with a small beige head. Nutty, earthy aroma with some caramel and hops. Medium body, average carbonation. Taste is light sweet, medium to high bitter. Long bitter aftertaste.

Rojo oscuro. Aroma a malta. Espuma media. Carboinatacion baja. Cuerpo medio alto. Sabor extraño con un cierto dulzor al inicio que se convierte rápido en amargo desagradable. Retrogusto amargusimo. No me gusto nada.
Limenka 0,5L - kupljena u Spicy daysu - Berlinska verzija...visoki postotak alkohola se gotovo i ne osjeti u okusu...suho...s dosta gorčine na kraju

Dark amber, thick bubbly head and it's lively. Smell is a little fruit and dry hop which follows through into a big, dry flavour. A little toasty malt, bitter hop, some fruit which just about carries through into the backtaste for balance. It's decent and tastes its strength.
Really very aggressive. Dark brown color, small size foam. Very concentrate citrus aroma, and very concentrate grapefruit bitterness in the taste. Awesome beer.

Wow ca dépote !
Pin agrumes, un peu amer, bière sèche et mousse crémeuse.
Je m'en souviendrai

Pours dark amber with a massive, structured beige head. Aroma is slightly sour, some caramel notes and a light hoppy aroma. Taste is very aggressivr upfront, a real CO2 kick, but it quickly gives way to a smooth, balanced body, which is then attacked from the back with a hoppy kick. Strong hoppy aftertaste.
Otestováno v rámci degustace v ostravském podniku Beers no.1. Detainější hodnocení přidám později.
Backlog z poprzedniego katalogu, ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień z grudnia 2017

AR: Hopfen, Harz, kräuterig, karamell, Gras
AP: leicht trübes rotbraun
TA: bitter, Hopfen, Harz, kräuterig, Gras

From reading about the beer I was expecting a variety of aromas, but did not sense much more than piny hops. I will give this Bastard the benefit of the doubt and assume the beer was too cold, old or both.  The malt taste hardly comes through in the middle, through the overpowering hops. The bitterness lingers on well after finishing this beer. I had expected more and feel this beer is overrated.
0.5l can. Pours hazy red with a large thick head. Aroma of dark fruits, caramel. Taste of roast malts, caramel, dark fruits. Strong bitter aftertaste. Not bad.

Аромат горький, солод, совсем немного хмеля, легкая травянистость. Цвет темно коричневый, пена средняя. Вкус горький и ядреный с самого начала. Много солода, легкие травяные нотки, намеки на мед. При глотке не резкая но сильная и продолжительная хмелевая составляющая, при чем без ноток цитруса, исключительно еловые вещи. В общем пиво для мужиков, а я наверно буду сидеть в петушином углу и пить Хугарден.

Pours reddish/copper with a big brown head. Aroma is alcohol, malt and some caramel. Body is rather plain and one-sided... Malt and alcohol but not something that stands out. High bitterness. Expected more with these ratings

16 ounce can at the house bought at Winking Lizard Macedonia Ohio. Smell both hops and malt. Rare combination for the same beer. Clear brown in color with a big light tan head. Taste the malt, smooth and alcohol is well hidden. Nice malted after taste. Really nice for the style and been around 20 years. A classic! Cheers!

A rather generic malt aroma with some grass and treacle - not too bad and unexpectedly restrained. But the balance is way out of whack, with a dose of bitterness that simply doesn't suit the bouquet at all. Like a Fernet Branca (or, worse, a German Underberg). That kills off any chance of depth or complexity. I think this beer is totally overrated - and wonder who falls for the adolescent marketing.
Aroma of nuts, caramel & almonds. Hazy reddish brown with a low creamy tanned head. Very bitter taste. Medium body, slick texture & average carbonation.

Can. Dark red amber ale. Thick light tan cream head. Nose is mild, light malts, a teensy bit banana. The taste is quite harsh, which is to be expected. There's tobacco notes, a slight burn, some lingering fruits, a deep maltiness. It's quite complex, and deserves a sip, a mouthplay and some time pulling out the flavour profile. I wasn't expecting this - I think I as expecting a hug bitter IPA style ale, which this isn't.

Can. Hazy amber to copper. Medium to large light beige head with medium retention. Aroma intensity 3.75/5. A good balance between hops, malt and yeast in the nose with notes of hay, cut grass, melon and cheese. Hops stand out in the mouth, with long finish heavy bitter. You keep chewing the beer after a long time. Medium body
That's a beer defining a style. American strong ale in its best. dark brown color with dark beige head. Great balance between sweetness and bitterness. Even the high IBU you want some more.

16 oz can. Great read on the label. Smells of a hint of citrus and pine, wasn't expecting that from the color. Brown in color. A delightful mix of sweet and bitter. A bit of caramel flavor, followed by a little pine and citrus. Has a lingering bitterness. Quite tasty.

0.5l can, bought at Berlin Schoenefeld Airport. Dark brown body with a hint of ruby. Beige creamy head. Aroma is complex, caramel, roasted malt, vanilla, some fruity freshness. Taste is roasted malt, caramel, liquor and some fruits in the background. Moderate carbonation, mild palate. Yet, aggressive aftertaste, bitter, burnt, smoky wood. Lasts very long. Typical American concept: remarkable beer with a strong, one-sided character, but still manages to show complexity.

The can says I won’t like it. They were right. And this sentence is so I can have 75 characters to make beer buddy happy. Wish I could keep my private notes private

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Ale, Strong Ale, Black IPA? Just a nice beer. I drink it for years if I can get it. Not too sweet, not too bitter but also not bland. I wish it was easier available.

Can @ Wawa, Sarasota. Drank from the can so no head description. Dark brown as molasses. Aroma of roasty dark chocolate and slight vanilla, wood, light smoke, and dark fruits. Taste the same...and smooth as silk! So yummy. Best ASA i ever had.
caramel, hay, amber, clear, frothy, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, average carbonation,

Minimal off white head on a reddish brown still body.
Medium bodied, sharp, clean & dry on the palate.
Bitter under ripe fruits, acrid tasting

Õlle on selline jook, et iga uus kord kui klaasi või pudeli suule tõstad, siis leiad midagi uut, sõltuvalt tuhandest-miljonist pisiasjast, mis hetke olukorda mõjutavad. Seega piirdun iga õlle juures selle tekstiga.

Pours dark coppery brown, big tan head. Ar9ma of roast mal, pecans, earth, pine, cocoa, turpentine. Flavor is bitter upfront, overt alcohol, some malt, tarry, earthy. Nice creamy mouthfeel before the alcoholic bitter aftertaste k8cks in. Interesting, but they were right, I don't like it that much.

Been a while since I've had this beer, but I remember it being very strong tasting. Nice malt backbone with a hint of sweetness and a bold up front hop flavor, though not to bitter for me. I really liked this beer

From a can. Dark bronze in colour with a thick head.
A caramel fruit and biscuity aroma.Full bodied with quite a bitter taste. Fruity and malty.
Definitely quality but quite a peculiar taste which might not appeal to everyone.
I enjoyed this beer.  Stout and not a fizzy drink. Itll put hair on your chest.

After a few years break from this beer I decided to come back fresh and rate it. It is bitter, very much so, like west coast people love, but it has a lot of backbone to balance it, so I understand why itis known as a great beer. Drank in Vienna
Malty and sweet aroma. Great caramell taste, fruity and taste of orange, honney & hops. Deep orange colour. Well balanced :-)

Can @ home, from Fleggaard. Clear amber w a beige head, nice lacings. Aroma heavy malty (caramel, roasted) and hoppy (grapefruity, citrusy). Flavor medium+ sweet and bitter with a long duration. Body medium+, oily, soft carbonated.

Color granate, translúcida. Espuma beige abundante y duradera. Aroma a maltas y, en menor medida, herbal. Sabor, en un primer momento a maltas y caramelo hasta que aparece el amargor, un poco agresivo. Esa sensación perdura bastante. No flaquees, ese demonio se quiere reír de tí.

Forte, più come corpo che come alcool. L'amaro che molti lamentano ha un attacco immediato, che però viene immediatamente contrastato dalla corposità. La schiuma è molto cremosa, morbida e persistente. Tecnicamente perfetta. Senza dubbio è questione di gusti, ma non è una birra da riprendere immediatamente dopo averla finita. Degustata dalla lattina, che permette una spillatura davvero perfetta!
Mid-high body. Very complex tastes. A bit fruity flavour. High alcohol. Bitter beer around 100 ibu i guess. Its my top 10 beer

Dos dedos de espuma de gran retención. En aroma se encuentran leves notas herbáceas y especiadas del lúpulo, además de un gran carácter maltoso y por último a frutos secos.
En boca es de gran cuerpo, fuerte presencia de las maltas y notas levemente tostadas, acompañado de cierto dulzor, luego llega el amargor intenso y levemente resinoso, para finalizar con un prolongado retro gusto amargo. Excelente cerveza
From tall can. Super bitter, tastes strongly of sweet tropical banana at first, washed back by malt and finishes with high hoppiness. Very bitter.

0,5l can. Pours cloudy mahogany with off-white head. Aroma of malt, caramel. a resinous bitterness, herbs, some toast also. Taste is bitter, malty, caramel. a cough syrup-like herbal and licorice note, dark fruits as it develops more. Finishes with bitter notes.
50cl can, rating based on past tasting aiming completion of rating profile. solid american ale with well hidden alcohol, maltiness fairly matching hoppy notes. very good

Can, 500 ml @ The Old Fishing Shack, CY. Another great ale with high alcohol content. Reddish brown colour, light beige head stays for a long time. Biscuit, strong sweet malty aromas with a hint of cherry inside. I thought it's British - the style suggests me it's British, but it's American, and comes from Berlin - funny. Brutal rich palate, relatively high IBU, long aftertaste. Amazing piece of beermaking again. Stone Brewery goes big! Just great from every angle. Top category ale!

En copa, cerveza oscura color caramelo, con una generosa capa de espuma color hueso de buena retención. Aroma muy intenso a cereales y caramelo, con matices de madera y licor. En boca, textura acuosa pero bastante compleja. Presenta fuerte amargor al inicio del trago, la cual perdura tras el trago. Resulta bastante dulzona, con presencia muy marcada de cereales, regaliz, licor y madera. Se detecta cierta presencia de alcohol en nariz tras el trago. Una cerveza compleja, fuerte e intensa, para tomar con calma y respeto.
Can. Pours a dark brown colour with a fluffy white head, hoppy aroma with plenty of fruit, the taste is medium bitterness and fruity with a dry bitter finish.

This is the beer that rocked my world 5 or 6 years back when I first had it. It brought me back to drinking beer. It probably had some influence in starting me brewing too. Picked this up in a long can for the first time today at Tanaka Shoten. They took the earthquake last week pretty bad and lost a lot of stock. I went in to see how they were and saw this one. I’m aware canning technique is at a higher level nowadays and I can’t say I was disappointed but it seemed different. Nose was there, caramel, sweet raisiny thing that doesn’t exactly promise much, but something in the back I like but I’m not sure about. Complex. Mouthfeel is great and slippery. Finish is bitter and bitter.
I love this beer to no end. I’d drink it everyday, but alas, I’m too cheap... or so it says on the matching glass I bought to go with the can of beer I got for nearly 700 yen.
Packing a punch at 7.2 the sticky sweet quenched by bitter is one of my favorites. Seem to remember enjoying it more from the bottle for some reason though.
Can. Aroma is malt, citrus and basement. Taste is bitter and malty with a hint of grapefruit. Bitter aftertaste.
Varies, but generally a very good ale. Pinch of bitterness at the top end but get over that and it's very rewarding.

Why is this a beer? This is by far the goopiest of hops. It's terrible and no one should drink this past one swig.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can. Thanks zvsn. Slightly hazy bronze with big bubbly beige head. Sweetish aroma with notes of caramel, dried fruits, tea bag and some fruitiness. The flavor is sweet with notes of alcohol, dried fruits, tea bag, caramel and some hops. Full-bodied. Too old, unfortunately.

Can, 0.5l. Deep red/brown pour, one finger frothy beige head. Medium retention, solid lacing on the glass. Heavily malty nose, lots of caramel and toffee notes, herbal touch, slightly liquory. 

Thin to medium body, medium carbonation. Average mouthfeel and texture. Mildly sweet taste combined with strong bitterness. Aroma is high malt with caramel and toffee dominating, low to medium hops, grassy. Lots of bitter herbal liquory notes. Strong alcohol presence, drying mouthfeel with pronounced burn on the tongue. Finishes long - dry, bitter and boozy.

Overall, pretty good ale. Not for everyone and not for every occasion, but personally this one hits the spot. Nice.

Can (bbd 08/18). Hazy amber with a huge beige head. Aroma of honey, toffee, marmalade, caramel. Sweet, honey, oxidized, fruity, toasted bread, toffee, alcohol, bitter finish. Medium bodied. Need to dry again.

Pivo u limenci.
Popijeno u Stella Beer2Go dućanu i kušaoni piva u Medulinu.
Jbt. Gorko
Aroma je fina sladna i lagano karamelasta , i malko suhovoćna.
Sa obzirom na tako sladnu aromu , očekivao sam nešto "punije" tijelo , a ustvari je više na Engleske Bittere , možda mrvicu punije. 
Okus slatkast i jbn. gorak !
Konačna ocjena je da je pivo zaista arogantno !
"Hoperi", obavezno probati ! ;)
From a beer hawk mystery case. Very bitter , sweet , caramel, malts.  A little like a very bitter brown ale. Lingering bitterness.  Needs the bitter taste to balance the sweetness.  Not bad.
0,5 l. Can. From Spicy Days Zagreb. Brown color with off white head. Malt and caramel aroma. Bitter, caramel and dark malt taste.

On tap at Cobb's Landing, Ft. Pierce, FL. Ordered this after ordering Founder's All Day IPA that had just kicked. I'm an IPA fan, and like both West coast and NEIPA/East coast styles. Have had both Stone IPA and Stone Delicious IPA, and have yet to be as amazed by Stone as so many seem to be. Thought I'd give then another try with this, and am so glad I did. The aroma is orange peel, grapefruit, pine, and I get some slight bready notes. The taste is powerfully citrus and dank hops, with a balancing malt flavor of barely sweet toastiness. Then the finish is clean but with a delayed burst of white grapefruit pith bitterness. This is a far more balanced beer than the other Stone IPAs I've had so far. It is big, yes, but balanced and delicious in a unique way. Glad I tried it. Will look for it in bottles or cans to try again.

Bardzo gęsta wysoka piana, Ciemna barwa, prawie jak black ipa, mętne. Piana bardzo ładnie zdobi szkło. W zapachu owoce, żywica, karmel. W smaku słodowo żywiczne. Bardzo ciekawe połączenie. Wychodzi też wyraźny karmel, alkohol jak z tych cukierków czekoladowych. W posmaku oprócz bardzo silnej goryczki (lekko zalegającej, chamskiej, minimalnie chemicznej ale jednak uzależniającej :) ) przypalona skórka od chleba. Warto zapoznać się z tym piwem, aczkolwiek nie widzę sensu żeby kupić je ponownie. Nazwa piwa adekwatna do tego co prezentuje, co doceniam :)
Cerveza bastante agresiva en paladar, trago rico y con matices a regaliz, densa, rica pero de trago complicado redondeado

7/26/18
At Whole Foods after finishing psych inpatient. 

Deep translucent brown with a moderate khaki head. 

Nose is sweet citrus hops with a hint of caramel maltiness. 

Taste is all hops. Bracingly bitter through and through. More piney than expected from the nose. Ends with a big dose of hoppy funk. 

Big palate with lots of carbonation. Hops bitterness stays until you eat something else. 

Overall, this is as aggressive as the label indicates but a bit heavier and more one-dimensional than I’d hope for in a really hoppy beer.

0.5l can in Berlin. Brewed in Germany.
Pours dark hazy brown. Very bitter finish. After a few sips normalises, but the aftertaste still lingers.
Hard alcohol taste.
Kolor bursztynowo czerwony. W zapachu troszkę alkoholu, słodowosc. W smaku rodzynki, trochę karmelu, wyraźna goryczka.
Ocena na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji na potrzeby uzupełnienia profilu.

Too much carbonation it just does not allow the beer to make its presence felt. Bitter finish. For some reason I get this heavy uncomfortable feeling in my stomach as I if I have eaten fast food and the food is sitting there and it is not getting digested. I bought a 6 pack and every time I open a new can I hope to find something new that will justify the high ratings. But it is the same old taste and feeling of disappointment.
From 1 pint can. Pours dark brown with brownish head. Malt and bitterness afterkick, pretty strong.

Puszka 500 ml. Zdecydowanie lepsze od wersji double. Ciemne, mocne, mętne, raczej goryczkowe amerykańsko ale nieprzesadnie. Takie lepkie (karmel, rodzyny), ale też imperialne, gładkie. Bardzo dobre, porządny kraft, porządnie ułożone i zbalansowane; ale to półka maximum minus 1.
Burk på Torrön. Härlig maltig saltmättad doft. Tung malig smak med lite källartoner. Smaken något tunn för att få högre betyg. Beskan mycket trevlig

Reddish-brown beer with lots of dark beige head, stays. Aroma is sweet malt, slight honey, hops. Taste is mostly malt, hops, but also slight bitterness from alcohol. Medium sweet, medium bitterness. Medium carbonation and medium body. Well balanced. Drinkable, pretty good beer.

Fresh out of a can. Pours hazy but shiny chestnut brown with a tight, creamy light tan head. Looks superb and I can't fault it. Treacle toffee sweeties are prominent on the nose with a floral touch of honey. Dry, grassy leaf builds a hefty bitter bite on the finish. Full, silky body with a light, crisp carbonation. There's a smooth and mature feel to this.  Looks aside, I was pretty underwhelmed with it to begin with but it rests and comes to life in the glass. It wins me over you big brown ale.

Bottle@summer cottage, from Alko. Medium/strong nuances of caramel malts, a lot of hops, resin, some toffee. Medium taste spectrum and medium aftertaste with hoppy resin and malts. Averagely balanced. Medium body with medium carbonation. Overall, quite flavor packed and sturdy product that still keeps its freshness via the bitter vibe. 8 4 7 4 15

Cloudy ruby-brown color with some particles, solid light brown head. Malty aromas, caramel and fermented dark fruits. At first, a direct hit of earthy bitterness, long and intense, that increases towards the end. Taste of roasted malt, ash, coffee and roasted nuts. Medium-high body, carbonation on point and an sticky resinous bitterness. The best unbalanced beer I've tasted.

Exceptional beer. Unique palate with many flavors. Perfect alcohol content. Truly a great beer.

22 ounce bottle. Orange, copper pour. Large, dense frothy beige head. Toasted malt nose hints at toffee and baked bread. Bittersweet toasted malt flavor upfront. Sharp and bitter, with resiny notes throughout. Burnt sugar and bitter pine. Intensely robust, but delicious.long bitter finish and aftertaste.

Kompot! Sweet caramel and fruit, strong malt character. Cloudy amber to brown color with medium to big sized beige head. Caramel and fruit taste with bitter finish. Medium body, lively carbonation, some warming effect. //can from Magic Beer Room
Amertume d'une peau d'agrume (chinotto par exemple) et caramel fumé. Expérience intéressante. Robe marron sombre avec des reflets orange.
Beer with copper color, medium bitterness, flat carbonized, good volume of foam, a good ale beer, (drunk a 30cl tap beer in "Žlutá Pumpa", Praha, CZ #699)(#4 US)(#3 California).

Clear dark amber with an impressive lasting tan rocky head. Sweet smell, with mango and bubblegum in the nose. Solid mango aroma, extreme wood laquer hoppiness that overshadows almost anything beyond the mango. Floral, peach, elderberry, light citrus touches, did I mention wood laquer? Penetrating dominant heavy bitterness of black tea that's been brewed way too long, medium sweetness. Nice mouthfeel, long bitter finish. In essence, this tastes like a decent IPA that's been mindlessly overhopped.

473ml Can. Pours a deep mahogany with lots of fluffy off white head. Rich malty nose with biscuits and subtle hints of toffee. Medium body with almost no carbonation. Strong malt flavours with a strong acidic hop palate. Similar to what I tasted in the Stone IPA but this has more body and flavour to mask it. After having two cans from the same brewery in this condition I have to assume it was the can itself.

Аромат солодовый, карамельный. Пена слоновой кости плотная, пиво красного цвета, полупрозрачное. Во вкусе солодовый вкус хорошего Эля, карамельный солод на месте с терпкой хмелевой горчинкой, послевкусие с фруктовыми и хвойными нотками, не срочно но и не сухо, в целом хороший такой эль

An amazing beer with the right amount of citrus hop notes with just enough of a sweet malt in the background. A very refreshing beer I could enjoy time and time again. A good favorite for sure.

Phenomenal beer. Dark and malty with a bouquet like an aboriginal's armpit.
Pours dark shadowy amber with thick cream-colored, sticky foam. Nose is malt, dried plums. Taste has some alcohol masked with malt, bourbon and some citrus with a hint of burnt molasses.

Original Review 7/6/10 when brewed by Stone - I haven't tried Stone's IPA yet, but imagine it would be similar to this...maybe a little lighter based on what their pale ale was like and their other brews that I tried. I liked the Ruination better, but was a few bucks more. Been meaning to sample this for a while, so finally glad that I did. I see this at certain bars and gastropubs from time to time so want to know what I'm getting into before I pay $5-6 a pint. Would and will drink again I'm sure, but wouldn't say it is one of my favorite IPA-ish type ales.

Fra 0,5 boks på Mi2 Cardinal april-18: mahognyfarge med flott skum som varer. Saftig aroma og smak med mørk malt, svisker, rå skogbunn, mørk sjokolade, solvarme urter i hagen og noe appelsinaktig. Kunne tenkt meg litt mer sødme, synes den er på grensen til ubalanse.

resin, floral, grass, spruce, citrus, herbs, sparkling, cloudy, amber, orange, red, brown, golden, frothy, minimal head, white foam, very bitter, medium bitterness, medium sourness, heavily sour, heavy cloying sweetness, medium sweetness, salty,

Shared can at Mi2 at Cardinal 23.04.18. Translucent dark orange. Foamy and persistent off-white head. Fine, but slightly earthy, aroma of oranges, bitter marmalade, succade and malt. Taste of American hops and sweet and bitter marmalade. High bitterness.
Not quite balanced. Too much bitter hops for the very slim body.  But exciting aroma, although a bit perfumed

Kolor bursztynowy w kierunku czerwonego, bardzo obfita, brązowawa piana. W aromacie toffie, karmel, rodzynki, przejrzałe owoce. W smaku karmel, dojrzałe owoce, figi. Trochę zbyt zalegająca goryczka, nie przypada mi to do gustu. Generalnie piwo bardzo spoko.

Reddish with of white head and slightly malty nose. Taste is rich in malts and hops. The devil is most likely the presence of bitter hops. Palate is rather long and Holding on to almost medicinal hops. Quite nice.

hopfig, Zitrusnoten, Mandarine, leicht malzig.

hopfig, bitter, schöne Zitrusnoten, weicher Körper, im Abgang wieder hopfig herb, mit dezenter zitrusnote. Globus
On tap at Fakin bar, Zagreb. Amber color with big brownish head. Bittersweet malt aroma with fruity notes and bitter aftertaste.

Faktycznie dość ekstremalne piwo. Zapach alkoholowo-goryczkowy w stylu amerykańskim. W smaku dość podobnie, trochę alkoholowo, ale głównie baaardzo wyraźna żywiczna goryczka. Dość jednowymiarowe piwo, ale myślę że w dobrym sensie, po prostu moc goryczki. Na plus bardzo gęsta piana i ładna barwa oraz zabawne opakowanie. Warto spróbować.

Tap @ Alles Elbe Hamburg.
Orangebrun med højt skum.
Aroma af malt, koriander, kanel. 
Krydret og sød i munden. Fuld krop.

Puszk z marketu w Seelow. Barwa ciemnego bursztyna o odcieniu czerwieni. Piana wysoka gęsta wolno opada, ładnie oblepia szkło. Aromat ziołowy, kwiatowy, trawiasty, nieco łodygowy a w tle karmele i syrop. W smaku trawiasta gorycz, karmelowa, nieco miodowa słodycz, finisz ziołowy wytrawny z odczuciem wysokiego IBU. Po niedługim czasie zaczyna męczyć. Piwo bezwzględnie goryczkowe dla fanów IBU.

Mocny aromat ciemnych suszonych owoców, miodu, drożdży, biszkoptu. Smak lekko podpalany, spora goryczka grejpfrutowo-pestkowa, trochę kawy, belgijskie klimaty drożdżowe. Bardzo pijalne, ale goryczka zbyt przytłaczająca jak na mój gust. I am not worthy.
Pours a ruby-copper with tan head. Grainy, hoppy nose. A bit of a harshness on the palate, but not in an unpleasant way. Vegetal, floral, and bitter as hell!
Sweet malty aroma. Clear dark ruby body with an robust head which falls reluctantly. Heavy rich sweet malt with warming. Delicious and robust.
V craft beer. Vona karamelovo kavova. Farba cerveno hneda. Chut kavova s horkastou koncovkou.

Birra complicada, de color marrón turbio, buen cuerpo, aroma a caramelo y madera, gusto maltoso dulce y con una amargor bastante cañera y persistente, parece una Scoth Ale pero lupulizada, para nada esconde el alcohol. Mola esta vacile de birra.
On Cask. I Know, why this is one of the most famous IPA... Very Very Hoppy, and Surely is not for the drinker of the commercial beer..I LIKE IT!!!
7.2% hazy brown in colour with a good head, sweet malt aroma and a very bitter but nice taste.

Miedziane, opalizujące, piana złamana biel, drobna i średnia, zdobi lekko szkło. Aromat wyraźna słodowość, karmel, owoce (rodzynki ale też truskawki) chmielowość leśna nieco żywiczna. Smak to słodowa podstawa i konkretna kontra goryczki już od pierwszego łyku, fakt długa, ale cóż... Jest owocowość, ciasteczkowość i chmielowa nalewka, przyjemnie wyklejająca. Nasycenie niżej średniej, gładkie i drobne.

473 ml can bought at Q Club in SoHo, Central.



Looks: Clear amber red colour; Explosive four finger head with long lasting crumpety beige foam; Excellent sticky lacing with very fizzy carbonation.



Aroma: Very fragrant Ale malt, with pineapple, citrus, tropical fruits, red fruits, strong caramel, strong toffee, toast, floral, molasses, spices, herbs, strong dry biscuits, yeast, lemon and grass.



Taste: Medium sweet full Amber Ale malt, with strong burnt toffee, caramel, red fruits, floral, molasses, spices, pine, herbs, strong dry biscuits, strong lemon, strong bitter grassy hops.



Body: Mid to full body; Dry, slick and oozy palate.



Mouth Feel: Very good Amber maltyness in a thick background, very dry and rich. Strong bitterness burnt toffee and toast dominates, surrounded by red fruits and caramel. Flowery with medium sweetness, piney herbal with lemon to round. Intensely good!



Hoppiness: Pineapple, citrus, tropical fruits, floral, spices, herbs, lemon and grass in nose. Floral, spices, pine, herbs, strong lemon and grass in taste; Bitterness - malt and hops - is very strong for a lasting, very high astringent bitter sweet burnt malty finish.



After Taste: Very dry. Herbal oozy and very bitter to mouth.



Comments: This is a strong Amber Ale with no holds barred, where the aroma is rich biscuity malty and tropical hoppy, its taste is immensely burnt toasty character, adding the good piney lemony hops and its bitterness is probably second to none (with exceptions of Nine Dragons Fist of Fury). A strong beer for the strong minded. Recommended!

Wygląd: Brawa ciemno miedziana, klarowna z bursztynowymi odcieniami. Piana od razu po nalaniu spora drobnopęcherzykowa beżowo - lekko żółta, po chwili opada do cienkiej warstewki, delikatnie olepiając szkło.
Aromat: Słabo intensywny, głównie słodowy - jasny karmel, trochę tostowy i chlebowy, min. toffie. Potem delikatnie rodzynki i cytrusy. Całość uzupełniona o akcenty chmielowe - ziołowo iglakowe.
Smak: Na starcie spora podbudowa słodowa taka sama jak w aromacie. z niewielką ilością rodzynek i cytrusów. Z tylu ziołowy chmiel. Słodowość fajnie przechodzi do mocnej, długiej i zalegającej (ale przyjemnie) goryczki ziołowej. Finisz nisko wytrawny, goryczkowy, lekko alkoholowy. After gorzkawo ziołowy z słodkością słodową. Treściwość średnia z dosyć gładkim ciałem, wysycenie średnie. 
Klasyczne piwo, dosyć charakterystyczne, takie bieda BW mocno doprawione chmielem.

Pours a dark ruby with nice head. Smell is hoppy and spicy. Hoppy and malty, balanced, upon the touch of my tounge. Afterwards I noticed flavors, and volitiles, of cloves and other spices I cannot name. Very interesting brew and not the first one I've had since it's easy to get in Myrtle Beach if you know where to look. Hits the spot if I'm in the mood for a punchy, aggressive beer that's hoppy but not an IPA or DIPA. Moral of this this all......


If you see it, buy it! You owe it to yourself
resin, citrus, dough, caramel, nuts, toast, good beer, but very overrated and not really my favourite style.

Bière arrogante, dont je me pose la question de savoir si cela vaut la peine de la coter ..
Quand je vois ce style de texte ("you are not worthy", et ce n'est rien au regard de la notice arrière !!) sur une bête cannette à la face de rat, je suis prêt à m'en aller.
Bref .. une bière de 7,2 % abv, ce qui - pour les States - constitue une "strong" .. on croit rêver !!
Ce n'est en tout cas pas un moteur de Harley !!
La validité du bidule est tout juste de 10 mois !! (Là on est dans l'industriel ..).
Couleur roux bordeaux foncé, à la clarté nette.
Bulles fines, partout.
Mousse beige, épaisse, crémeuse, stable à 3 mm.
Arômes de potiron, poire, malt cara.
1ère bouche souple, à l'entame fruit/bois/résine/réglisse.
Arrière-bouche assez sur la réglisse.
2ème bouche malt cara/épices.
Arrière-bouche à le densité inférieure à la 1ère (déjà).
3ème avec fruits confits et muscade.
Arrière-bouche peu équilibrée, épicée.
Longueur en baisse progressive et perte totale d'harmonie.
Jambes hyper collantes.
Levure basique.
Alcool qui ne fait pas son niveau, il ne travaille aucunement les saveurs.
Finale très médicinale.
CONCLUSION : avec des propos médisants envers ceux qui n'apprécieraient pas (éventuellement)
ce liquide coloré, on ne peut qu'être très en retrait !!
Attitude strictement indigne .. et petite bière à la face de rat. (2/3/2/2/1)
Ocena na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji, puszka 0,5 (Berlin) kupiona w hipermarkecie.

aroma of a sac full of pennies whilst eating a caramel.
taste is caramels and malt; even less hoppy than the aroma.
appearance is equal parts red, brown and gold; copper with the tint of a gulf of Mexico sunset. the mix of large and tiny bubbles resembles a cafe laté.
the palate is perhaps the most impressive part of this beer, besides the awesome marketing. somehow, the bitter hops emerge through the malt and deny any sweetness.
overall, I can see how this would be mind-blowing in the year 1997 (think: Sierra Nevada,) but two decades later, many other offerings are more attractive on many levels.
Hodně kontroverzně udělané pivo, které mě dosti překvapilo, i když to úplně není můj šálek kávy. Americké strong ale piva jsou mi dosti podobné silným hořkým ipám. Ale i tak oceňuji originalitu.
(brun, nez hop, > sucre brun, fruit red/noir/sec, mad dry, > pineau, rétro fructosée, kill-∞-hoppy-ing me softly)

Aroma - is big rich pine and crystal malt. It's bold.
Appearance - is a dark amber with a big white head.
Taste - rich pine and crystal malt.
Palate - medium body, average texture, average carbonation, and a bitter finish.

Puszka 0,5 l. Piwo uwarzone w Berlinie. Wypita 14.01.2018. Data ważności 26.11.2017. Mimo upływu ważności piwo nie traci na jakości. Barwa miedziana - rubinowa, zmętniona. Genialna, beżowa, gęsta i trwała piana. Tworzy niezły czop. Aromat dość intensywny, cytrusowy. Od razu czuć amerykański chmiel. W smaku karmelowe, słodkie. Alkohol jest wyczuwalny, ale nie dominuje. Wysycenie średnie.

Berlin Brewed. A: Darkest shade of amber, medium sized tanned head, left lots of lacing. S: Dark chocolate and cocoa beans. T: Very bitter high quality dark chocolate, cherries, very long lingering bitter finish. M: Very smooth, almost creamy texture, low carbonation. O: A real wintery ale, very nice.

2. Verkostung 2018: 

Stone Arrogant Bastard gegen Stone Ruination Double IPA. Der Bastard kam bei der ersten Verkostung nicht gut weg. Kastanienfarben und blank mit einer großen Krone aus beigem Schaum. In der Nase dunkles Malz und bitterer Hopfen. Diesmal ist das DIPA wärmer, das macht es etwas erträglicher. Der Körper ist voluminös, die Kohlensäure gering. Der Geschmack ist stark herb vom Hopfen mit Verstärkung der bitteren Noten des Malzes. Das war es aber auch schon. Extrem herb vom Hopfen ohne besonderes Hopfenaroma und bitter vom dunklen Malz. Meine 40% Bewertung in Prosa heißt “trinkbar aber nicht gut” und das passt hier wie die sprichwörtliche Faust aufs Auge. Da ist das Ruination DIPA einen Tick besser.
40%

1. Verkostung 2017:

Auf dem Etikett ist doch alles gesagt: 
wir sind arrogant und unser Bier schmeckt Scheiße! 
Dem kann ich nur zustimmen. Ich glaube bei unserem Tasting hat keiner sein Glas ausgetrunken, ganz im Gegensatz zum Chouffe Houblon. Das ist auch ein IPA, das hat noch mehr Alkohol und das kann im Gegensatz zum Stone Braukunst aufweisen. 
Wenn ich mir noch eine Dose runterquäle folgt eine detaillierte Beschreibung.
40%
Aroma of hops, fruits, dark caramel. Dark amber color with brown head. Dark caramel, malt, dry finish, bitter. Medium body, medium carbonation.

500ml can from RusBeerShop in Moscow, Berlin-brewed version. Pours clear copper with a medium-sized beige head. Aroma is grapefruit, toffee, hops. Taste is caramel malt, citrus, heavy bitter, warming alcohol.
Bruin oranje bier, medium, aroma is malt, citrus, grapefruit, Taste is the same, dry bitter taste and aftertaste, not bad
Poured a clear copper with a thick tan head. Tastes like grapefruit with some caramel. Lots of hops. Ok beer.
Can from Berlin. Pours orange copper color with a transient beige head and a hoppy, fruity aroma.

After all those years Arrogant Bastard still delivers as a great Beer.

Rubinowa barwa z trwałą, ładną pianą. Aromat biedny, trochę kawy i żywicy. Na pierwszym planie konkretna goryczka, kawa, trochę karmelu. Na dłuższą metę dla mnie mdłe. Alko dobrze ukryte. Ok, nic więcej.
Pours a clear deep mahogany with a full beige head. Nose is sweet malt and hops.Taste is sweet malt, toffee with a bitter aftertaste that lingers. 16 oz can Canned: 11/8/17 Fresh. BBY: 3/18/17

0.5l can. Hazy ruby body with a huge, thick and lasting dark beige head. Looks great for sure. The aroma is mostly about dried fruits like dates and raisins with just a bit of citruses and pine and some nutmeg to give it a spicy twist. The taste on the other hand is all about hops. Loads of pine and some grapeseed in the taste without the dried fruits present in the aroma. Only a bit of toast here to represent the malts. Could be way better with a bit of caramel or dried fruits in the taste, but I still find this nice. Its price is also very nice (it was brewed in Berlin and I bought it in Budapest).
It's a strong ale, for sure. Too much hop flavor for my tastes, there's no hint of malty undertone, just hops. It looks great, with the color and head, but i wish it was balanced better.

Uzupełnienie profilu notatki.
Piana obfita zdobi szkło, utrzymuje się. Kolor zmętniony bursztyn wpadający w czerwień. Aromat ubogi, delikatnie las, iglaki. Smak pełnia, karmel, ALE-owa delikatna owocowośc, chmielenie w żywiczny-cytrusowy charakter. Wyraźna dość wysoka, lekko zalegająca goryczka, alkohol ukryty. Piwo dobre, solidne, pije sie przyjemnie, choć jak na styl za mało american i za mało strong. Na pewno bez zachwytów i top50 w ratebeer mnie dziwi bo są lepsze piwa w stylu bez tego tytułu.
Pre-RateBeer review, so no tasting notes. 4/5 note jotted in my 1001 Beers guide. Will return to this beer when I get the chance. Had on draught as a guest beer in a BrewDog bar.

Pours a deep, dark ruby red coloration with a large, creamy head. Smells faintly of biscuity, caramel malt, toffee and red berries, with a hint of citrus and pine. Taste follows the nose, with a firm, slightly sweet and caramelly malt presence backed up by bitter, resinous, hops and notes of pine, toffee, red berries: redcurrant, strawberry and citrus: grapefruit, lime peel, as well as just a hint of chocolate. Finishes with a strong bitterness and some red berries and pine lingering in the aftertaste. Full mouthfeel with a medium/rich body and medium carbonation This is an expertly crafted and balanced Amber Ale that has great complexity to it without sacrificing drinkability. The balance between sweet malts and quite bitter, resinous hops is exceptional here, with some nice layers of citrus and red berries, as well as slight toffee and chocolate notes inbetween. Arrogant Bastard will forever be my go-to beer, as long as I can get it fresh anyway. While some might say that this ages nicely, it really needs that resinous bitterness to work in my opinion, which really starts to fade out after about 10+ weeks.

Probably the most unpleasant beer I've ever tried. And you lose points for being cocks. Perhaps there's a good beer in there somewhere, but then they added drain cleaner. There is no need for this level of astringency. If Trump made beer, it would have this level of self confidence and total lack of taste and drinkability.

Arogancko puszczone w żywioł słodu i chmielu, w tonacji gorzkiego karmelu, mogłoby być zdyskwalifikowane za niezrównoważenie gdyby nie piarowy elaborat na etykiecie i legenda awangardy craftowej. Do przyjęcia, pozycja obowiązkowa z powodów historycznych.
Brown colored beer with a hudge white head.  Taste is bitter and malty. Long bitter afthertaste.

0,5l can from Pivný raj bottleshop, Bratislava, Pours deep murky red to brown liquid, big frothy tan head, Aroma: bittersweet, full and complexe, citrus, grapefruit, pine, malty, caramel, red fruits, candied, fruits, zesty, Taste: medium to heavy sweet, heavy bitter, light to medium sour, grapefruit, citrus, zesty, malty, very hopy, caramel, red candied fruits, slightly warming alcohol, Palate: medium heavy to heavy body, soft carbonation, creamy to thick mouthfeel, long almost harsh, bitter finish, Overall: very good, enjoyed, thought would not be able to drink a second one, too much bitter. Domininant is the overwhelming citrus bitterness complimented with rich malty, caramel and candied notes.

Vom Fass (Brewed at Berlin/D) Stone Brewing Berlin 2016-06 getrunken. Ich habe hier ein aggressives Bier vor mir. Es hat mir nicht geschmeckt. Abgesehen davon ist es ziemlich fraglich, dass ich genug Geschmack oder Erfahrung besitze, ein Bier mit dieser Qualität und Intensität richtig genießen zu können. Stone riet mir also, in gewohnten Gefilden zu bleiben... - Gute Idee der Werbabteilung von Stone also lasse ich diese dunkle Hopfen-Bitterbombe hinter mir und freue mich über ein schönes anderes Bier...

24-09-17 // 500ml can at Stone Brewing Tap-Takeover at Naiv in Frankfurt. Shared with Greg Koch himself!! Hazy Brown beer, solid head. Sweetisch nose. Taste of roasted malts, heavy sweetness, with an aggressive bitterness with Grapefruit touches.

Bottle at home. Pours red brown amber with a frothy beige head. Aroma is heavy roasted malt, sweet malts, caramel, grapefruit, moderately hoppy. Taste is heavy sweet malts, then big bitterness, juicy hops, light grapefruit. Medium to full body, soft carbpnation. Long dry, bitter finish. It's a beer that's big on flavour, but it's not for me.
0,3 litre draft at Seb's Hotel, Hamar. Cloudy Brown with medium offwhite head. Not Too bad.

Pours a reddish brown color. One finger beige head. Okay retention, great lacing.

Aroma is malty, very malty. Caramel. Very hoppy.

Taste is quite strong. Quite bitter. It's also sweet.

Mouthfeel is full bodied. It's heavy, thick. It's a sipper, no chugging this one. Smooth.

Overall, this is very good. I would buy it again, and I would recommend it.

From Mar 2007

Pours from 22oz bottle(room temp) a clear deep amber with a huge head of foam that just won't quit. Solid layer with lots of lacing.

The smell is very hoppy. I note grapefruit in big abundance.

The taste on first sip is hugely hoppy. Lots of citrus that makes your mouth want to pucker but just before it does, the malt moves in and somewhat tames the hops. No, more than that. The malt actually takes over the flavour and I'm not talking really sweet caramel malt...wait...yes I am. Wow. You fooled me. ;^) Boy, is this a treat.

Further sips in and I'm getting more of the balanced flavours but mind you, while the hops and malt seem to be working in unison, I cannot deny that the said flavours are as big and bold as the great outdoors. Like the label says, this is an aggressive beer and it refuses to let you just sit there and reach a comfort zone; when you're sipping on it, it takes center stage and all others things going on around you become mere side shows. What an egotistical brew and...I'm loving it!

Bottom line: A fantastic brew that will earn your attention whether you wish to or not. Highly recommended!

From the tap at FOB, Rimini, Italy. Pours a beautiful red with nice reflections. Aroma is toasted, caramel. Body is average, with limited carbonation. Taste is toasted at first, then quite some bitterness kicks in, an old school one. Finish seems not that long initially, but bitterness comes up when you least expect it and lasts very long.
one of my favorites; reddish-brown color; malty, piney aroma; really well balanced; bready malt and piney hops; assertive and full of flavor and arrogance

Cor âmbar com tonalidade rubi, translúcida e com leve brilho; espuma bege com médias formação e persistência e bom lacing.
Aroma intenso de lúpulos resinosos com caramelo e cítrico de toranja em segundo plano e ainda um toque de álcool.
Sabor já de início com bastante amargor resinoso e leve caramelo, com meio fugaz de dulçor de frutas amarelas e final de amargor resinoso "arrogante"acompanhado em segundo plano de madeira e álcool; retrogosto intenso e persistente de amargor adstringente com um toque de álcool.
Corpo médio e baixa carbonatação.

W aromacie na początku dzieje się niewiele lecz po lekkim ogrzaniu piwa aż nadto wyraźnie aktywują się gotowane warzywka.
W smaku przyjemny balans słodu i goryczki chociaż bez charakterystycznych punktów odniesienia (lub zaczepienia).
Nienajgorsze piwo.
A może piwo dobre tylko
I'm not worthy?

From tap at Stone Brewing World Bistro & Gardens, Berlin. Nearly clear, dark copper color with a beige head. The aroma is lightly hoppy (orange, pine) along with some honey, some bready malt and hints of yeast in the back. Medium body with a light sweetness and a medium bitterness. The flavor is light to medium malty (biscuit, caramel, honey) followed by lots of bitter hops and some woody notes.

Wersja z Berlina. Ciemnobursztynowo-rubinowa barwa, zamglone, piana kremowa, średnio obfita, drobne i średnie pęcherzyki, zostawia ładny lacing.
W aromacie rodzynki, truskawki, nektar, lekki miód, lekki karmel, lekkie owoce tropikalne, żywica, nieco cytrusów.
W smaku chmielowe - świeży chmiel, nieco łodygi, trochę melona i grejpfruta i rodzynkowe, dużo rodzynek. Nieco porzeczki. Poza tym słodki nektar, karmel. W posmaku chmielowe, łodygowe, słodkawe. Goryczka dość mocna, tytoniowa, lekko zalega. Wysycenie średnie.

Pint can poured in Glass. An excellent American Strong Ale. (I admit I haven't tried many American Strong Ale's) Pours a dark Amber/medium brown. Fluffy head that dies down after a few minutes with a little lacing. The aroma was the only thing underwhelming about the beer. the taste is very robust. Caramel, mild citrus, malty, slightly sweet, and finishes just a little bitter. Best part is the message on the back. If you don't like this beer --keep it to yourself. Classic.

„Arrogant Bastard Ale", Dose (50 cl) aus einem Supermarkt in Berlin. - Laut Dose „gebraut in Deutschland von Stone Brewing Berlin“ - und trotzdem von RAB unter der kalifornischen Mutterbrauerei geführt? - Dunkelgoldbraun, schwach trüb, rasch zerfallender Schaum. - In der Nase tiefe, warme aber gar nicht allzu intensive IPA-Aromen: Mango, Orangenschale, Nadelwald, Harz. - Im Antrunk intensive Grapefruit-Hopfenherbe mit wuchtiger harziger Bittere. Fülliger karamelmalzig-nussiger Körper. Milder rezent, vollmundig. Im Abgang - natürlich - noch mehr hammerharte harzige, leicht holzige Bittere. - Noch ein gutes Stück stärker  als die meisten IPAs aber keineswegs besser, auch nicht sonderlich komplex. Ein großmäuliges Bier, das alle Stereotypen auf die Spitze treibt; genau das Richtige für verhaltensunsichere Craft-Bier-Adepten ...

Dark amber/cider color; Medium body; Aroma of caramel malt, spicy hops, & some citrus; Flavor of slight sweet malt, caramel/toffee, spicy hops, and citrus; Finish is slightly bitter; Nicely balanced; Overall, a classic - very good.

(Keg) This is another classic from the Stone Brewing enterprise. Pours a clear dark amber beer, with ultra-fine carbonation, and a creamy beige head. Rich aroma of rum and raisins, fig and plum pudding, vanilla, smooth bourbon whisky, warm winter spices, and vanilla. A subtle pine and mineral finish. Smooth, light, delicious. 

Though the taste is slightly underwhelming, the aroma is simply mind-blowing.

50cl can brewed in Berlin. Smooth malty and moderate sweetish beginning. Fruity bitterness with herbal hints. Intense bittered, but round and refreshing in total. Long fruity malty bitter aftertaste, caramel, toffee, intense bittered. Great!

500ml can from Beer Hawk. Pours dense, ruby with a ark, ample head. It’s thick and syrupy with a mild aroma of figs. The taste is fierce and malty, dry and bitter with pine and plum. Reminded me of Old Peculiar. The more you drink, the better it tastes.

Barwa miedziana, piwo klarowne, piana beżowa, uboga. 
Aromat średnio-intensywny, karmel, niuanse suszonych owoców i tytoniowo -ziemisty chmiel. 
W smaku pełne, karmel, melasa, cukier trzcinowy i średniej wysokości tytoniowa lekko cierpka goryczka.

Tap @ Beertemple, Amsterdam IX 2017. Goeie schuimer waarbij het fijn aan het glas blijft plakken en met een verleidelijke ambere kleur. Fijne niet heel sterke geur. Volle zoete smaak. Bloemig met honing. Met een wauw effect. Is dit ook een Ale? En strong voor 7,2??? Dat noem ik nog vrij bescheiden. :-) Het heeft dus een beetje zoete smaak met onder karamel? Gewoon een fantastisch hoppig biertje met een diepe rijke smaak zonder al te zoet te worden. Dat ik hem vaker drink is nu gewoon een feit!!!
Cerveza muy muy amarga pero también muy bien equilibrada por sus maltas,con cuerpo, buena espuma.

Great beer if you like the dark frothy full of flavor type beers!! Very smooth and tasty!

I have to give this one an overall best for their presentation, I was laughing throughout drinking this beer. "It's funny, because it's true."
Started to read the description and had to try after the first sentence. The worst part of this beer is.... finding others like it!  I cannot wait for them to expand their line of beers.

Barwa miedziana, przejrzysta, piana średniopęcherzykowa, bardzo trwała. W aromacie słodowo, karmelowo, trochę wiśni a w tle amerykański chmiel. W smaku mocno goryczkowe, zalegające, ale w przyjemny sposób. Wyczuwalny karmel, wiśnia, amerykański chmiel, toffi oraz nuty chlebowe. Pełnia średnia, alkohol niewyczuwalny. Wysycenie na średnim poziomie.
0.5L can. Dark amber color, fluffy fat beige foam on top, stays. Moldy, raisin, stale wood aroma. Mmm. Rye, bread, caramel taste. Nice bitter finish. Lovely bitter mouthfeel. Good beer.

Murky dark amber, huge off-white head, good persistence and lacing. Aroma shows caramel malts, slight dark bread and resinous hoppiness. It's fairly intense and fresh but quite monotonous. Taste has medium sweetness, medium to high bitterness and persistent resinous bitterness in the aftertaste. Notes are of caramel, resinous/piney hops, slightest earthiness and spiciness. Medium body with average carbonation, drinks quite easily. Decently enjoyable and very much unimpressive. The only thing arrogant about this is pretentious labeling.

Hazy mahogany color, beige head. Malty nose, bread, caramel, brown sugar, fruity notes, hint of yeast. Sweet taste, caramel, rich malty, grapefruit, resin, bitter finish, well balanced. Definitely not my favorite style, but this one really did it. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, smooth texture. 

7, 4, 9, 5, 17

I found this can, in one Coop, supermarket in Prilly. I drank it on Monday, relax, at home with my wife. Personnaly, it is not my favourite one of this brewery. Of course, it is drinkable and strong like the Evil, a beer to become drunk like the drunk men that you could see at the Riponne, in Lausanne with the difference that this beer is better than the 88. The body is brown/red/copper, regular carbonation for the style, thin and white foam. The taste has a really strong presence of alcool, you feel that coming through your body like the Russian vodka, malty, sweet, some hop but the malt is dominating and the alcool gives this note of sweetness, not bad, perfect before to sleep.

500 ml can (Berlin),bb 03/02/2018.
Reddish/brown,clear. Light beige head,medium lacing.
Caramel,herbal aroma.
Taste - bittersweet (bitter mostly),caramel,bitter finish. Flat,one dimensional,just bitter,nothing more. Meh.

500 ml Berlin can. Pours with reddish-brown color and a medium off-white head.Nose of earthy hops, roasted malts, some yeast and some toffee. Very strong, bitter taste, slightly licorice sweet, resinous. Strong bitter finish.
Bottle, present from US brought to Uk by Jo. Backlog entry. Entering my historic scores for US beers whilst visiting New York. No tasting notes kept, just rating.

Can (Berlin)! Medium amber opaque brown with a medium tan foam subsiding slow. Scent is dense notes of barleywine. Cherrywood. Taste is light, frothy, lightly citric barleywine, I think. Possibly properties of rye. Finish is dry and light. Tiny bit of apple, hinting at imperfection. Great.

F: huge, tan/tanned, good retention.
C: dark to dark coppery against the light, hazy.
A: a lot of caramel malt, fruity, grapefruit, biscuits.
T: big malty backbone, biscuits, citrus, fruity, caramel, long lasting bitterness on the palate, bit herbal/floral, bit warming alcohol, full body, low to medium carbonation, very good, really enjoyed, 50cl can as “Stone (Berlin) Arrogant Bastard Ale” from Bierwinkel De Hopduvel in Gent.
Birra davvero aggressiva, non posso dire che mi sia piaciuta davvero. � una strong Ale rossastra con Aroma stranamente puzzoso, al palato amaro davvero strong e impegnativo.
Si eres novato en el mundo artesanal, mejor trata con otra cerveza menos agresiva y mas balanceada

12oz bottle. Pours mahogany brown with a thick beige head. Aroma is pine, toffee, and lots of malt. Taste is very hoppy (pine and earth) matched with lots of malt (toffee, toast, caramel, hints of dough, etc.) with some fruits and a touch of metal as well. Light-medium body. Moderate carbonation. Creamy mouthfeel.

From 473ml can. Poured with rich, inch high head with great retention. Aroma was of metallic berries, not good. Aroma is more caramel malt as it warms. Taste is of malt with a little sweetness, then strong bitterness in the back end. Not that impressed

500 ml can as Stone Berlin. Served in tulip. Pours blood red, with big fluffy and firm head. Fantastic look. Bitter grapefruit aroma and some other tropical fruits, elderflower, some dark cherry, some metallic and earthy notes. Heavy hoppy bitterness. Alcohol perfectly hidden. Soft carbonated, full body. Bitter finish. Palatable. Long lasting aftertaste. This beer has character.
